column4: Can anyone help me get Ubuntu started with my Nvidia card? It simply won't boot with it in use
I made a forum thread about it but it seems no one knows how to fix it
Hold on Jowi I get you the thread
did you install ubuntu with a different video card?
yes and no, I could install the alternate cd with my fx, but not with the live cd
well in that last screenshot, it's trying to use the intel driver
have you tried disabling the intel card in your bios?
have you tried disabling the intel chip in the bios?
it uses that driver for all intel chips
that chip can run beryl btw
does Berly run poorly on this card? it only has 8MB of memory
how can I enabled 3d acceleration on this card?
it's possible you need to increase the amount of videoram allocated to it in the bios
I did, it only allows me to select 1 or 8mb
